titles.ar: باب عِلَّةِ كَيْفَ صَارَ لِلذَّكَرِ سَهْمَانِ وَ لِلْأُنْثَى سَهْمٌ
titles.en: Chapter 9 – Reason how it came to be two shares (of inheritance) for the male and for the female, one share

titles.ar: باب مَا يَرِثُ الْكَبِيرُ مِنَ الْوُلْدِ دُونَ غَيْرِهِ
titles.en: Chapter 10 – What the eldest from the children inherits besides others

titles.ar: بَابُ الْعِلَّةِ فِي أَنَّ السِّهَامَ لَا تَكُونُ أَكْثَرَ مِنْ سِتَّةٍ وَ هُوَ مِنْ كَلَامِ يُونُس‏
titles.en: 9. The Reason Why Ordained Shares are not more than Six

titles.ar: باب عِلَّةِ كَيْفَ صَارَ لِلذَّكَرِ سَهْمَانِ وَ لِلْأُنْثَى سَهْمٌ
titles.en: Chapter 9 – Reason how it came to be two shares (of inheritance) for the male and for the female, one share

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/129)
text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ إِسْمَاعِيلَ بْنِ مَرَّارٍ عَنْ يُونُسَ بْنِ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ عَنْ أَبِي الْحَسَنِ الرِّضَا ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قُلْتُ لَهُ جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ كَيْفَ صَارَ الرَّجُلُ إِذَا مَاتَ وَ وُلْدُهُ مِنَ الْقَرَابَةِ سَوَاءٌ تَرِثُ النِّسَاءُ نِصْفَ مِيرَاثِ الرِّجَالِ وَ هُنَّ أَضْعَفُ مِنَ الرِّجَالِ وَ أَقَلُّ حِيلَةً فَقَالَ لِأَنَّ اللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ فَضَّلَ الرِّجَالَ عَلَى النِّسَاءِ بِدَرَجَةٍ وَ لِأَنَّ النِّسَاءَ يَرْجِعْنَ عِيَالًا عَلَى الرِّجَالِ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ismail Bin Marrar, from Yunus Bin Abdul Rahman,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Al-Hassan Al-Reza<sup>asws</sup>, (the narrator says) ‘I said to him<sup>asws</sup>, ‘May I be sacrificed for you<sup>asws</sup>! How did it come to be such that when the man dies and his children are all equal in the relationship, (but) the women (the daughters of the deceased) inherit half the inheritance of the men (sons of the deceased), and they (women) are weaker than the men, and of less capabilities?’ So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Because Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic Preferred the men over the women with a level, and because the women return for the dependency upon the men’.
en.sarwar: 1. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ’Isma‘il ibn Marrar from Yunus ibn ‘Abd al-Rahman who has narrated the following: “I once asked al-Rida’, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, ‘I pray to Allah to keep my soul in service for your cause, why is it that when a man dies his sons’ shares of the legacy are twice as much as the share of his daughters even though females are less capable and weaker?’ He (the Imam) said, ‘It is because Allah, most Majestic, most Glorious, has preferred men over women and because women become dependents of men.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/129)
text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ إِسْحَاقَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ النَّخَعِيِّ قَالَ سَأَلَ الْفَهْفَكِيُّ أَبَا مُحَمَّدٍ ( عليه السلام ) مَا بَالُ الْمَرْأَةِ الْمِسْكِينَةِ الضَّعِيفَةِ تَأْخُذُ سَهْماً وَاحِداً وَ يَأْخُذُ الرَّجُلُ سَهْمَيْنِ فَقَالَ أَبُو مُحَمَّدٍ ( عليه السلام ) إِنَّ الْمَرْأَةَ لَيْسَ عَلَيْهَا جِهَادٌ وَ لَا نَفَقَةٌ وَ لَا عَلَيْهَا مَعْقُلَةٌ إِنَّمَا ذَلِكَ عَلَى الرِّجَالِ

فَقُلْتُ فِي نَفْسِي قَدْ كَانَ قِيلَ لِي إِنَّ ابْنَ أَبِي الْعَوْجَاءِ سَأَلَ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) عَنْ هَذِهِ الْمَسْأَلَةِ فَأَجَابَهُ بِهَذَا الْجَوَابِ فَأَقْبَلَ أَبُو مُحَمَّدٍ ( عليه السلام ) عَلَيَّ فَقَالَ نَعَمْ هَذِهِ الْمَسْأَلَةُ مَسْأَلَةُ ابْنِ أَبِي الْعَوْجَاءِ وَ الْجَوَابُ مِنَّا وَاحِدٌ إِذَا كَانَ مَعْنَى الْمَسْأَلَةِ وَاحِداً جَرَى لآِخِرِنَا مَا جَرَى لِأَوَّلِنَا وَ أَوَّلُنَا وَ آخِرُنَا فِي الْعِلْمِ سَوَاءٌ وَ لِرَسُولِ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) وَ أَمِيرِ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ( عليه السلام ) فَضْلُهُمَا .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Muhammad, from Muhammad Bin Abu Abdullah, from Is’haq Bin Muhammad Al Nakhaie who said,

‘Al-Fahfaky asked Abu Muhammad<sup>asws</sup>, ‘What is the matter that the poor woman, the weak, takes one share (of the inheritance), and the man takes two shares?’ So Abu Muhammad<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘On a woman, there is neither Jihaad, nor (living) expenses, nor is there the stronghold (household expenses). But rather, that is upon the men’.

So I said within myself (thought), ‘It was said to me that Ibn Abu Al-Awja asked Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> about this problem, so he<sup>asws</sup> answered him with this answer’. So Abu Muhammad<sup>asws</sup> faced towards me, so he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Yes! This is the problem asked by Ibn Abu Al-Awja, and the answer from us<sup>asws</sup> is one, when the meaning of the question is one. It flows for our<sup>asws</sup> last one what flowed for our<sup>asws</sup> first one, and our<sup>asws</sup> first one and our<sup>asws</sup> last one, in the Knowledge, are one (the same), and for Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> and Amir Al-Momineen<sup>asws</sup>, there is preference for them<sup>asws</sup> both’.
en.sarwar: 2. Ali ibn Muhammad has narrated from Muhammad ibn abu ‘Abd Allah from Ishaq ibn Muhammad al-Nakha’iy who has narrated the following: “Once, al-Fahfakiy asked abu Muhammad, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, ‘Why is it that the destitute and weak woman’s share of the legacy is half as much as the share of man?’ Abu Muhammad, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, said, ‘It is because there is no Jihad on women; maintenance expenses and wergild to be paid by the relatives of the murderer, it is on men.’ I then said to myself that I was told about ibn abu al-‘Awja’s question to abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about this issue and he had answered with this answer. Abu Muhammad, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, turned to me and said, ‘Yes, this is the question of ibn abu al-‘Awja’ and the answer from us is one if the meaning of the question is the same. What applies to the last of us applies to the first of us. Our first and last in knowledge are the same, however, the Messenger of Allah, O Allah, grant compensation to Muhammad and his family worthy of their services to Your cause, and Amir al-Mu’minin have their excellence.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/130)
text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ حَمَّادٍ عَنْ هِشَامٍ عَنِ الْأَحْوَلِ قَالَ قَالَ لِي ابْنُ أَبِي الْعَوْجَاءِ مَا بَالُ الْمَرْأَةِ الْمِسْكِينَةِ الضَّعِيفَةِ تَأْخُذُ سَهْماً وَاحِداً وَ يَأْخُذُ الرَّجُلُ سَهْمَيْنِ قَالَ فَذَكَرَ بَعْضُ أَصْحَابِنَا لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) فَقَالَ إِنَّ الْمَرْأَةَ لَيْسَ عَلَيْهَا جِهَادٌ وَ لَا نَفَقَةٌ وَ لَا مَعْقُلَةٌ وَ إِنَّمَا ذَلِكَ عَلَى الرِّجَالِ وَ لِذَلِكَ جَعَلَ لِلْمَرْأَةِ سَهْماً وَاحِداً وَ لِلرَّجُلِ سَهْمَيْنِ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Hammad, from Hisham, from Al Ahowl who said,

‘Ibn Abu Al-Awja said to me, ‘What is the matter that the poor woman, the weak, takes one share (of the inheritance) and the man takes two shares?’ He said, ‘So one or our companions mentioned to Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, so he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘on woman, there is neither Jihad, nor expenses, nor a stronghold (household expenses). But rather, that is upon the men, and due to that one share was made to be for the woman, and for the man, two shares’.
en.sarwar: 3. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘Umayr from Hammad from Hisham from al-Ahwal who has narrated the following: “Once ibn abu al-‘Awaja’ asked me, ‘Why is it that the destitute and weak woman’s share of the legacy is half as much as the share of man?’ He (the narrator) has said that certain persons of our people mentioned to abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, who said, ‘It is because there is no Jihad on women and maintenance expenses and wergild to be paid by the relatives of the murderer; which is on men.
